commit.message:
Do not throw error when no tracing headers are sent (#43)

It is quite typical for services at the edge to receive requests with no
tracing headers. This case shouldn't throw an exception but rather return
None, as we are starting the root span. This is consistent with the
documented behavior of extract on Tracer:
https://github.com/opentracing/opentracing-python/blob/946f763510a8c26a66d5c53a9c4d0c6027cb9129/opentracing/tracer.py#L214

Co-authored-by: Logan Capaldo <lcapaldo@factset.com>

commit.message:
Add example usage (#33)

* added an example of basictracer usage to readme

* set example language in readme

* moved ex from readme into example dir

* made more complete example, documented ex dir in readme

* added more detailed header comment to ex

* added example output to ex header comment

* fixed orphaned word in ex header comment

* made span logging ex output more useful

* logging ex: fixed to use span id instead of trace id

* made example log parent span id

* updated log output in ex header comment
Back to development: 3.1.1
Preparing release 3.1.0

Unpin OpenTracing dependency and change to a range (#40)

* Update setup.py

This should not be a `==`.

* Update setup.py

* ༼ つ ◕_◕ ༽つ

* ಠ╭╮ಠ

Add support for Python 3.5+ (#39)

As a software engineer, I'd like to have support for modern versions
of Python declared in setup.py and to have corresponding tests on CI.

Also, I'd like to be able to conveniently run tests
in my local environment, so I want to add a tox config file.

These changes:

 - Add Python 3.5+ to setup.py and .travis.yml

 - Add tox.ini

 - Add a mention of tox into Development section of README

 - Simplify the tests requirements

Including 0,1 as a acceptable sampled value (#37)

* Including 0,1 as a acceptable sampled value

Accepting "0", "1" strings as a sampled value.

* tests of sampled field string values

* simplified in condition

commit.message:
update license to Apache 2.0 (#32)

Replace MIT license with Apache 2.0 license.

Signed-off-by: Andrea Kao <eirinikos@gmail.com>

Add LICENSE information to README (#29)

* Add LICENSE information to README

Signed-off-by: Prakriti <prakritibansal98@gmail.com>
Add build/test/release instructions. (#28)
Back to development: 2.2.2
Preparing release 2.2.1.

Update our opentracing dependency to be >=1.21 and < 2.0. (#27)

This way we will get the latest version of the 1.x series, which should be just fine, as no API breakage should happen.

Remove unused dependency (#22)

Closes #21.

Make the tracer lib compatible with both Python 2 and 3. (#20)

* Make the tracer lib compatible with both Python 2 and 3.

1. We add the six module as a requirement, as it
   provides a layer of compability between 2 and 3.
   Moreover, we use it for the metaclass declaration.
2. We use bytes() when extracting data from the binary
   propagator. For Python 2, this is simply an alias
   to 'str' (the use we used till now); and under 3,
   it keeps the same behaviour, as 'str' now converts
   to utf8, hence breaking the data/tests.

* Require six < 2.0.

We do this, instead of requiring any 1.* version, to
be in a safer position, requirements-wise.

* Require six < 2.0 and >= 1.10.0

Add build instructions (#18)



* more proper way

Better late than never with semver
